did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Mab Segrest is a feminist writer, scholar, and activist who received her PhD from Duke University in 1979. During her time in North Carolina, she was on the editorial board of Feminary, the feminist literary collective founded in the Triangle in 1969. She also worked with a group called North Carolinians against Racist and Religious Violence (NCRRV). This inspired her 1994 autobiographical work, Memoir of a Race Traitor, in which she describes working against the Ku Klux Klan in North Carolina. Segrest also worked as the Coordinator of the Urban-Rural Mission from 1992-2000, after which she returned to academia. She is currently chairs the Gender and Women's Studies Department at Connecticut College.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions

p.emph: The majority of the collection is closed for research. Accession 2006-0027 is open to research.

accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.

All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in
Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour
delay in obtaining these materials.

Most of the audiovisual components in this accession are not immediately
accessible because they require further processing before use. Unless otherwise noted, Technical
Services staff need to reformat for use copies of the films.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Mab Segrest Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Mab Segrest papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1991, 1994-1996, and 2006.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession(s) described in this collection guide: 1991-0158, 1994-086, 1995-088, 1996-124, and 2006-027

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: This collection (Accession 1991-058) (6000 items; 8.0 lin. ft.; dated 1967-1991) contains materials documenting Segrest's personal life and education through 1975, and her professional life from 1977-1991)
Addition (1994-086) (2250 items, 3.0 lin. ft.; dated 1992-93) documents Memoir of a Race Traitor and the Third Wave Foundation.

Addition (1995-088) (5625 items, 7.5 lin. ft.; dated 1970-1994) comprises documentation relating to Segrest's professional life, including Memoir of a Race Traitor, the Third Wave Foundation, activism files, and a typescript of Dorothy Allison's Bastard out of Carolina.

Addition (1996-124) (2250 items, 3.0 lin. ft., dated 1995-1996) contains files relating to projects, the NC Coalition for Gay and Lesbian Equality and the North Carolinians Against Racial and Religious Violence (NCARRV), and the Center for Democratic Renewal (CDR)

Accession (6000 items; 8.0 lin. ft.; dated 1967-1991) contains materials documenting Segrest's personal life and education through 1975, and her professional life from 1977-1991)
Acquired as part of the Sallie Bingham Center for Women's History and Culture.

accessrestrict.p: Closed: Accession 1991-0058 is closed to research.

scopecontent.p:
Accession (2250 items, 3.0 lin. ft.; dated 1992-93) documents Memoir of a Race Traitor and the Third Wave Foundation.
Acquired as part of the Sallie Bingham Center for Women's History and Culture.

Accession (6000 items; 8.0 lin. ft.; dated 1967-1991) (5625 items, 7.5 lin. ft.; dated 1970-1994) comprises documentation relating to Segrest's professional life, including Memoir of a Race Traitor, the Third Wave Foundation, activism files, and a typescript of Dorothy Allison's Bastard out of Carolina.
Acquired as part of the Sallie Bingham Center for Women's History and Culture.

Accession (1996-124) (3.0 lin. ft.) contains files relating to projects, the NC Coalition for Gay and Lesbian Equality and the North Carolinians Against Racial and Religious Violence (NCARRV), and the Center for Democratic Renewal (CDR).
Acquired as part of the Sallie Bingham Center for Women's History and Culture.
